message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.RO 

This paper proposes a CNN cascade for semantic part segmentation guided by pose-specific information encoded in terms of a set of landmarks. The paper focuses on computer vision tasks such as landmark localisation and semantic part segmentation, which are typically covered in the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The use of CNNs for these tasks also suggests that the paper may be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper applies its architecture to the problem of facial part segmentation, which is a common topic in multimedia (cs.MM) research. Finally, the use of landmarks to guide segmentation suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category, as landmark-based navigation is a common technique in robotics.
